body:
I just repro'd this with my Contoso project with EF Core.

@lbargaoanu perhaps it's time we moved the tests from EF6 to EF Core...

issue.title: Operation could destabilize the runtime with ProjectTo and NHibernate

body: Anybody interested in EF Core is welcome to add a test project similar with AutoMapper.IntegrationTests. All existing integration tests use EF6 where this is not an issue.

@lbargaoanu The MyGet build seems to have other unrelated changes as well. I get a compiler error trying to use it:
`'IMapperConfigurationExpression' does not contain a definition for 'Advanced' and no accessible extension method 'Advanced' accepting a first argument of type 'IMapperConfigurationExpression' could be found (are you missing a using directive or an assembly reference?)`

Commenting out my usage of Advanced - `mapper.Advanced.RecursiveQueriesMaxDepth = 4`
It compiles but then crashes on startup:
```
System.MissingMethodException: Method not found: 'Void AutoMapper.MapperConfiguration..ctor(AutoMapper.Configuration.MapperConfigurationExpression)'.
   at AutoMapper.ServiceCollectionExtensions.<>c.<AddAutoMapperClasses>b__12_2(IServiceProvider sp)
```

So looks like MyGet build not compatible with AutoMapper.Collection 7.0.0 either?
No, [the other MyGet build](https://myget.org/feed/automapperdev/package/nuget/AutoMapper/10.1.1-alpha.0.1) :) Perhaps you need to clear the NuGet cache. Check the date, it's like minutes ago.
Ok that works and looks like MyGet build fixes the issue. The mapping workaround with released version also seems to work for me. Thanks!
This issue has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
